media:group.media:title: Are We All Actually Archaea?
media:group.media:description:
Check out another Complexly production: Journey To The Microcosmos https://youtube.com/microcosmos
The unexpected discovery of an entirely new domain of life was pretty huge and surprising - even if archaea do just look like bacteria. But, in recent years, it’s been their connection to us that's turned out to be particularly full of surprises - ones that may mean we have a connection to a group known as Asgard.
***** PBS Member Stations rely on viewers like you. To support your local station, go to http://to.pbs.org/DonateEons *****
Produced by Complexly for PBS Digital Studios

entry.title: Darwin Missed An Example of Evolution Right Under His Nose

media:group.media:title: Darwin Missed An Example of Evolution Right Under His Nose
media:group.media:description:
Kallie's book "Tales of the Prehistoric World": https://bookshop.org/p/books/tales-of-the-prehistoric-world-adventures-from-the-land-of-the-dinosaurs-neon-squid/17724211
The 2023 Eons calendar: https://www.complexlycalendars.com/products/eons
Charles Darwin encountered a tiny fox-like creature during his famous voyage but instead of discovering its fascinating evolutionary story, he just knocked it on the head with his geology hammer.
Thanks as always to Julio Lacerda (https://twitter.com/JulioTheArtist) for the tremendous reconstruction of Darwin's Fox!
***** PBS Member Stations rely on viewers like you. To support your local station, go to http://to.pbs.org/DonateEons *****

media:group.media:title: Eons Live: An Epoch Livestream
media:group.media:description:
Our 2023 calendar is available now at https://ComplexlyCalendar.com!
For National Fossil Day October 12, 2022 the Eons team is having an "epoch" 4-hour livestream! Join us for paleontology and natural history themed games, a tour of our studio, and a Q&A with the team. The fun starts at 2:00 ET/11 PT.
--- A note from PBS: Contributors need to provide their full legal names and provide their city and state. As funders of public media programming, the names of donors will be stored by PBS and made publicly available upon request. Depending on the production budget of the individual program, donors may be acknowledged in the show’s credits.

entry.title: Our Ancient Relative That Said 'No Thanks' To Life On Land

media:group.media:title: Our Ancient Relative That Said 'No Thanks' To Life On Land
media:group.media:description:
Around the time that some of our fishapod relatives were crawling out of the water, others were turning around and diving right back in.
Thanks to Fabrizio De Rossi for the incredible reconstruction of Qikiqtania for this episode! https://www.facebook.com/ArtofFabricious/

media:group.media:title: Where Did Water Come From?
media:group.media:description:
Mercury, Venus, and Mars are all super low on water – so where did ours come from and why do we have so much of it? We think our water came from a few unlikely sources: meteorites, space dust, and even the sun.
***** PBS Member Stations rely on viewers like you. To support your local station, go to http://to.pbs.org/DonateEons *****
